title: Man dies after car flips over and catches fire following police chase
text:

A man has died after a car flipped and caught fire following a police pursuit.

The car failed to stop for police near Taunton railway station in Somerset at 2.30am today, according to the The Independent Office for Police Conduct (IOPC),

The driver of the car was taken to hospital with life-threatening and has since died and two other passengers are in hospital with serious injuries.

An IOPC spokeswoman said: “We have begun an independent investigation following an Avon and Somerset Police pursuit this morning.

“Initial information suggests the incident happened after a car failed to stop for police. It later crashed near to Taunton railway station in Clifton Terrace at around 2.30am and set alight.

(Image: SomersetLive/ WS)

“After being notified by Avon and Somerset Police we sent investigators to the scene and to the post incident procedure.



“The driver of the vehicle was taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries and has sadly since died."



“We will shortly be making contact with the man’s family to explain our involvement.”

Two other occupants sustained serious injuries and have also been taken to hospital, reports Somerset Live.

An Avon and Somerset police spokesman said: "We were called to reports of car, which was believed to have been stolen driving erratically at about 1.30am this morning on the A38 near to Wellington, driving towards Taunton.

(Image: SomersetLive/ WS)

"It failed to stop for officers and shortly afterwards after driving with a deflated tyre stopped outside the former Taunton police station in Shuttern, where the driver was arrested on suspicion of theft of a vehicle.

"Shortly afterwards at about 2.30am officers saw a second vehicle, which was believed to have been stolen.

"This vehicle also failed to stop for officers who followed it.

"Shortly afterwards the vehicle crashed near to the railway station in Cheddon Road (opposite Kilkenny Court), ending up on its roof and setting fire.

"Fire and ambulance services attended the scene.

(Image: SomersetLive/ WS)





"The driver was taken to Musgrove Park Hospital with possible life-threatening injuries.

"The front seat and rear seat passengers have both been seriously injured and have been taken to Southmead Hospital.

"Road closures remain in place at the site of both incidents and police investigations are continuing.

"The force’s professional standards department have been advised.

"A referral has been made to the IOPC (Independent Office for Police Conduct)."
description: The car failed to stop for police near Taunton railway station in Somerset at 2.30am
